entry.title: Why people use JIRA
entry.content:
Jira is a popular project management tool used by thousands of projects, but do developers really like it?

how much jira do we have to use before we're agile?

— 0operator (@sadoperator) October 5, 2017

If they don’t, then why people use Jira? Well, Information Technology industry is more about deception than real science and software, and Jira is much needed by management folks for deceiving their client, so they use it.

Jira has done lot of brand building

First, Jira has done lot of brand building, it has made people to believe using it will make things cool ad people have some how believe it. Some how none who bat for Jira can publish a scientific study that Jira has improved their efficiency.

Jira is a jargon

Most of clients are ignorant, you tell them that you are using big data with blockchain and everything is managed by Jira where he can know the status of the project at his finger tip, then he would succumb to the jargon and think you are great and you really know stuff.

Jira introduces inefficiency

Clients and management like to see their team sweat out even if things are really easy. Trust me, I am a programmer for 15 years and I have seen how people make simple things complex and make you go mad.

Jira introduces inefficiency into project, it makes the project difficult to manage and you need managers to do it. This creates fake jobs, plus having a manager means the company can bill the client more.

Atlassian needs to survive

Atlassian is one big corporate mess of fat ass bosses who needs to feed like pigs, go on to Italian holidays, stay in star hotels and claim that they have changed the world for good by introducing Jira, if you don’t use them they have to make a living by cheating the world in another way. So please trust and use Jira without questioning.

Stay happy living like a goat as ignorance is bliss.

entry.title: What can I do if computing prices are falling?

link.title: What can I do if computing prices are falling?

entry.content:
So we got a new client, he wanted to migrate from a previous service provider to us. We have built a web agency thats cutting edge, we have developed automation to such an extent that manual labor is reduced by 90%, and we are aggressively pursuing Artificial Intelligence.

My friend asked how much the infrastructure of the new client will cost, I said a price that would baffle him, it was just 1/400th the price of the previous service provider that had been milking our to be client. My friend flew on a rage, ‘you open source people just think about cost, there are other aspects there is service, value and business angle’ he said.

Then I gave an another quote thats 12 time larger than the previous one and said you can pay and buy beefy machines if you like, none stops you, but for this project this look enough.

The global server prices have fallen. We don’t rely on Amazon, Rackspace, Heroku and stuff like that, we just simply use our own trusted server bank that has enough replication to prevent data loss. To our surprise we found our offering to be faster than Digital ocean.

Digital Ocean is just a startup, which means that it barks and markets a lot than it bites and does real stuff. Something is wrong with their server which take lot of time to respond. And Amazon AWS is far worst, one would never know why it stops or starts all of a sudden and why it lags more. Too much virtualization I suppose.

People who are in the closed source, in the Microsoft camp can’t imagine if something is darn cheap it can be good. They simply lack imagination. Possibly they will value shit more higher than gold if some one can sells it to them at greater price. And people who are in Microsoft, and Apple technological products are doing just that, they are selling shit and are feeling good about it because you have paid a higher price.

Somehow free software people I see are able to look beyond the money and corporate glare, possibly none is trying to make them dumb, or possibly they are more democratic or something. They seem to have more common sense.

entry.title: India is not just two party state

link.title: India is not just two party state

entry.content:
One of my friends tweeted this

If not modi who else, Shall we bring back Manmohan?. I not seeing much difference between congress and BJP other than communal issue

— Jahith Hussain (@jahith) September 27, 2017

It was response to this tweet

Should Narendra Modi continue as Prime minister of #India? | #Politics

— Karthikeyan A K (@karthik_ak) September 27, 2017

I asked blunt to twitter users weather Narendramodi should continue as Indian P.M or not? Its right for a person to vote, its right for a person to change his choice of vote to any candidate or to NOTA at any time I feel.

Many people think about instability. What will happen if one can vote again and again, possibly multiple times a day? Won’t governments change just like that? Yes it will. But isn’t a job of citizen of a democracy to be educated and not bring instability in a nation? Or does a person think its the duty of the government to force stability in a land that it rules? Which do you think is right?

People seem to be having wrong notion, they feel people or nation can decide better if we had limited choices. People feel like there must be a one major ruling party and one minor ruling party, they must keep the nation stable.

I respect their thought. I respect them choosing not to have choice, but now take the case of India, my nation. We have two major parties, one is Congress which is ultra corrupt and another one is relatively less corrupt or good at hiding corruption, its called as Bharathiya Janatha Party.

Lets say that I am a Biz tycoon dealing with billions of dollars a month. How long it would take for me bribe leadership of these two parties? No matter who comes to power, since I control the money I control the law, the flow of information and hence citizens of my nation will think I am good guy all the time unless a miracle happens. One or two might find out what I do, but its easy to eliminate or silence them.

Now lets see how dynamic democracy works and how it will make politicians tremble. In dynamic democracy any one can vote any time, or the voting time period is reduced shortly, say 10 days (I wish it could be 10 minutes). You can cast your vote once in every 10 days and it will be anonymous. Lets say that 10,000 people vote in a village, say if there is more than 6000 votes registered in past 10 days, then the system will count the votes, who ever has majority will be elected and dismissal order will be sent to the person who was on power and if he had lost. Things will be automated.

Dynamic democracy requires two steps, two very independent thing. There will be voting Kisoks all over the country. It will have two independent systems. The first is an access system. It will take in your biometric and check if you unlocked the system in past 10 days. If the system was not unlocked it will order the voting software to take charge. The voting software doesn’t know who you are, it will simply list the candidate and record a vote. Thats it.

The access control software and the voting software shares no data. In fact the voting can be recorded and shred in block chain to make it really transparent. Knowing that one can be evaluated every 10 days will put shivers on politicians spine, will make them obey to people quick rather than to dodge them in a hope that they will forget it during the next voting season.

What will happen because of Dynamic Democracy?

Dynamic democracy is not just voting reform, it should also be the way one stands for election. One should be able to stand as candidate in a place just by clicking few buttons in an app. Why do you think one need to pay the sate or follow formalities for one to be elected? That looks stupid to me.

So any person having the right idea should be able to become candidate, challenge the incumbent in an instant. This way we will have richness, and not just people sticking to two parties. We must not go by party politics, instead we must go by idea politics and elect people who align with our ideas and are passionate about it.

I see no different between parties and cults. I wish people who rule us be independent thinkers and free souls.

entry.title: Indians should be ignorant
entry.content:
The government is afraid of people getting knowledge. Well thats what the signal Indian government is sending out. Recently it had blocked Archive org, why? Well none knows why really why? But in India somehow government seems to get away violating the constitution now and then.

Its strange that a country that calls itself a democracy is unwilling to let its people experience the world via the internet 100%. India claims that its citizens have the right to information and free speech, and right to have rights granted by our constitution but its really good at hiding things.

Take for instance the article 49-O which we know now as NOTA or No To Anybody. This means in each election apart from the list of candidates provided, the voters should have a NOTA option. That is they should be able to tell that they like to vote for none. For more than 60 years our politicians have stealthily kept this right given to us by our constitution away from us. Why?

Why a ruler who really wants to respect constitution of India do such a thing? The reason? Politicians if they can fool people at every opportunity thats available to them, they will fool us for their gain. It doesn’t matter we are ruled by Congress, BJP or some coalition.

The Panama papers have named lot of people who were indulged in looting their nation and stashing money into Panama. Because of its leak the Pakistani Priminister Nawaz Sharif had to step down, but why it hasn’t affected India? Whole India gossips that a mere actress like Aishwariya Rai had evaded taxes and stashed wealth in Panama, have you ever wondered why and how she is free? Infact she is not even a drop in the vast ocean of India’s wealth thats looted and stashed in other countries. Why are we more weaker in implementing justice than Pakistan who we regard as barbaric tribesmen invading our land?

Internet helps people to distribute things like Panama papers, Wikileaks documents and others in much easier fashion. These things can be easily hosted on Archive org or Pirate bay and so on for all Indians to see, and it terrifies the Indian government, the oligarchy and the rich to know that people have the way to know and find out about their corruption.

In fact time and again Torrent sites gets banned in India all of a sudden and we don’t know why. When an Islamic terrorist puts up a site say about how he plans to destroy India, it will be banned here. We as citizens are not allowed to know who threatens us, and most important we should never know why he is doing it.

India is actively discouraging bitcoin too as it fears that people will find true financial freedom and possibly big money banks won’t be able to fund political parties. Having a good relationship between banks and politicians is important. For example there is a guy called Vijay Mallaya who looted India of 9000 crores and is happy in London. India is simply doing nothing because he might have nexus with Subramaniya Swamy of the Ruling BJP. So since this guy has looted the bank which is called SBI, to offset its loss it (SBI) starts to loot people. SBI says SMS bank statement is charged, there is charge if you maintain a balance thats low, there is a charge if you move money in and out of your account, there is charge if you breathe. So it lost 9000 crores to a man connected with politicians and is now aiming to loot Rs 900 from each of its 10 crore customers. With bitcoin that won’t be the case.

If you are an Indian, there is just one thing you must know. Your government says you are a free citizen, and its say it is good . Then why the hell its blocking us to use the internet in free way? Doesn’t things smell fishy here?

entry.title: Wy can’t students get away with one exam?

The funny thing is though I studied hard for my 12th exam and got decent marks, it was not enough. I had to take exams to get into Engineering course. I then wondered why can’t I take an exam straight for engineering degree and avoid 12th or why can’t people be smart enough do design exams in such a way that if you have passed 12th you are qualified to get engineering?

If someone eyed for medicine or engineering, then they must take 3 exams. One for 12th, another for medicine entrance and other for engineering entrance. In this modern world where people are getting stressed because so much is put on their shoulders, I truly wonder why there must be so many exams?

I feel education system in India and possibly in most of industrialized countries are broken, and I feel the world looks qualified enough but is not educated enough to realize that its mostly made up of stupid people and they are the ones who are controlling us.
